row.text: I wanted to design a house the owners would feel was a best friend.
When I design houses for people I think of myself as their hands and eyes.
Ultimately, a house is purely a prop, a backdrop for your life.
Good architecture is not about novelty or difference. It's about comfort and resolve... in an accurate casting between house, and location, and people - together.
Good design is never self-conscious. It's like assembling a table for dinner guests. It is not the loudest voice that has the most to say.
The most pertinent information comes through the expression that is between the lines. If I can get a grasp on why the house is, then I can create what the house is.
The house is like meeting someone of great stature who opens his heart to you immediately.
I don't specialize in any particular style as much as I combine various styles to fulfill my intentions. I conceive things from the inside out.
When I design houses for people I think of myself as their hands and eyes.
My houses are romantic. There is a great deal of romance about them.
My definition of style is grace and understanding, utility and accommodation. Grace and utility are paramount, if not the same.
The particular spirituality or morality which lies behind choices provides the genesis of good design.
I don't specialize in any particular style as much as I combine various styles to fulfill my intentions. I conceive things from the inside out.
The particular spirituality or morality which lies behind choices provides the genesis of good design.
